annotation.TEXT: Hey, guys! Wanna see ON/OFF blocks messing up graphically? Check out my first automatic Mario level, where they briefly become Rex heads when hit!
Yep, gotta correct those sprites whenever they get a math problem wrong. Hey, sprite, 2 plus 2 does not equal 5!
No Yoshis because they're allergic to light switches.
It doesn't look like there's anything up here at all.
Also, this room scrolls up for some reason...
Ah, yes. The much-anticipated sequel to this epic thriller!
I'm pretty sure "desired," could've fit on the previous line there. Also, "no time on the clock" means setting the level's time limit to start at zero, which actually gives the player unlimited time.
Yeah, so apparently, you can climb in some spots in the credits as if they were vines. I did not know this (or if I did, I had completely forgotten about it).
Yep, you sure showed us how to pay attention to spelling in the previous level!
Oh, you mean like Easy, Normal, Hard, and Lunatic?
Yeah, because on certain X positions, it'll produce the Yoshi's House fireplace fire and chimney smoke, which probably doesn't belong anywhere but Yoshi's House.
Yeah, but don't be mean and hide enemies or traps where the player can't see them.
Oh, man! Gotta indicate them tiles!
Such a happy block... Let's see if it gives Yoshi any special powers... Also, the game just hands you two free 1-ups here.
Oh, I've gone over the tops of walls in hacks I don't know how many times...
Now, Portal's Companion Cube on the other hand... That's definitely one of the Blocks That Matter!

I remember how one of the computer monitors I used in the past was so dark, even when set to maximum brightness, that I couldn't see jack squat in a dark level unless I also turned off the lights in the computer's room as well. There must've been some problem with that particular monitor...
Now, it sure looks like there is an arrow in the dirt tiles there. I wonder what it could be pointing at...
Aw, but remakes are cool... if done really well.
Oh, I'm sure some people think impossible is fun. But seriously, make sure it's not impossible or near-impossible. Make the time limit reasonable.
Moon count: Still 1
Well, that's three rows done, but the bottom row is made up of actual "level" levels, so I do believe I'm going to be saving those for next time!

This can allow you to reach the 5-up heart and 3-up moon even without Yoshi. There doesn't seem to be any hidden vines under the note block though, but it's not like you'd need them for anything there.
What about heavy switches?
Hmm... Gotta think of something clever to say here... But anything I can think of saying is too similar to something I've already said...
Yay, vines. At least Yoshi's not allergic to these, though he can't exactly make use of them...
No Yoshis because they're allergic to ON/OFF switches.
Yeah, those sprites will go on strike unless you give in to their buoyancy demands.
This is a duplicate moon collection, so the "moon count" will not increase.
Aha! Two hidden 1-ups!

Yeah. A short song like Dead or Alive - Right Around should not be the main theme of a level that takes like ten minutes or so to complete, or it can drive the player crazy in short order! Save songs like that for short bonus areas or P-switch/Star tunes.
Yeah, be sure to play nice with your toys so you don't break them!
Huh. These note blocks aren't bouncy for some reason.
Play nice, now!
Oh, wow... That's a lot of levels! Well, let's start with the top row, going from left to right.
So, does anyone want me to test a hack?
Well, whatever sinks your boat...
Huh. The screen scrolls up here. Whatever.
Yep, and then you'll be all like "Whoops! The game just crashed!" until you fix the problem.
Yep, I'm sure most (if not all) of us have made that mistake before.
Oh, how about this: "Hi, Yoshi!" ...Wait, I already use that quite often. Wait, what were we talking about again?
Heck, yeah. Yoshi's Island music.
Oh, no. We can't have black lights that emit UV rays in our levels. Mario might get sunburned!
To be continued... In "Ice Paradise", an epic spin-off parody to the "Correct Sprites" series!
Yes, definitely. Also, the same goes for reset pipes too.
Is there anyone that hasn't ever tried making an SMB 1-1 remake? I know I have.
Yeah, don't make a moon that acts like a muncher, or I will not be pleased.
Ooh, a cape! I believe that's the first one in this hack!
Bad puzzle. Bad, bad puzzle. Sit. Staaay...
And I wonder how many of us have experienced these types of things in hacks?
Well, I'm not seeing any special Yoshi powers here, but what did I expect from what's simply a graphically-changed key?
Umm... Yeah. What this says.
Oh, this is neat-looking.
No Yoshis because they're allergic to certain level modes.
Yes, it is so avant-garde to spell "avantage" that way.

Okay, I think that was every "vine" in the level, or at least every "vine" that's meaningful. If there's one in an obscure spot that I'm not aware of, I'm not going to bother with it unless it leads to another item.
Alright, now let's see what levels await on the other side of this warp star...
There's something in Credits that I didn't show off last time, that a couple of you guys pointed out to me.
Yeah, put in ceilings or something to make sure I can't just fly over every level, because if there's a way to break the level by flying, I'll likely find it!
Now, this is a neat idea that I don't think I've ever actually seen in any other hack. Does anyone know of any other hack that uses this idea?
Oh, yeah, and take advantage of certain ASM ON/OFF block stuff, yada, yada.
Oh, and by the way, you aren't obligated to play any of the levels on this map, as you can move freely here at any time.

I don't think I've seen this idea used too often, but I have actually seen it before in a few places, such as the Portal-themed level in The Cookie Crisis, I believe (the key is the Companion Cube there).
Yep. Something happy and exciting probably wouldn't work well as the main theme for a ghost house, for example.

Yeah, this could be a pain in some devilish levels that have you headbutting a row of ON/OFF switches while traversing ON/OFF platforms. Hit your head on two switches at once in such a level, and you're probably dead!
Gulp! Whoops, Yoshi swallowed the key block! Well, that's okay. It's not like it's a block that matters here.
I wonder what mode world 3-1 of Chaos CompleXX is set to...
Next!
Huh. Well that looks interesting...
Ugh! I know! I hate it when something has horrible music, or the music seems good at first but has a sour note or doesn't loop quite right, or things like that!
Yep, I believe I showed a prime example of that kind of cutoff in one of the early forest levels of this hack.
Well, they might be amusing to people watching the player, but still, they really should be avoided.

Oh, and on top of that, note blocks can mess up graphically too if they're in the wrong environment. For instance, my seventh automatic Mario level, which takes place in a ghost house, has the note block graphics glitch up as they're being hit.
Musical notes?
Hello, and welcome back to Hacks 101! In this episode, I'll be going through this warp star, but first...
What kind of options, like being able to switch the sound between mono and stereo, or maybe adjust the difficulty?
Yeah, okay, whatever. If I ever need help with gradients, I'll keep that in mind.
Okay, now since I'm already over here on the right, I'll do the second row from right to left.

So, yeah, very important: Don't place your vines on Layer 2. However, I'm pretty sure putting vines on Layer 1 in a level that makes use of Layer 2 is okay. (I wonder... Is there any patch to fix the Layer 2 vine issue yet?)
"G3" ...You sunk my battleship-- Er... My floating platform. However, there is an actual solid floor below these platforms, so you can't sink with it.
Max out? You mean like how 400 x 50 = 62464?
Alright, we're done with row #2, and I'm on the left now, so let's do row #3 from left to right.
